example.eg: Jane felt to see if the accident victim had a pulse.
example.egtrans: 简摸了摸事故受害者的脉搏，看是不是还活着。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 脉搏, 脉（或心）的一次跳动

example.eg: Too much caffeine can cause you to have a fast pulse.
example.egtrans: 摄入过多咖啡因会导致脉率升高。

example.eg: The pulse of the music made Alison want to get up and dance.
example.egtrans: 音乐的节奏引得艾莉森想起身跳舞。

example.eg: Liam walked into the party; the music was pulsing and people were dancing.
example.egtrans: 利亚姆走进聚会中，音乐在搏动，人们在跳舞。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 搏动, 打节拍, 打拍子

dsense.name: pulse
dsense.guideword: figurative (life of a city) (比喻城市的)

example.eg: The city's pulse seemed to have weakened since Paul's last visit.
example.egtrans: 自从保罗上次访问以来，这座城市的活力似乎有所减弱。

dsense.name: pulse
dsense.guideword: often plural (edible seed) (如豌豆、黄豆等)

example.egtrans: 扁豆和鹰嘴豆都属于豆类。

example.eg: Belinda's heart pulsed as she hid behind the curtain.

dsense.name: pulse
dsense.guideword: figurative (city life: be alive) (指城市生活)

example.eg: It was two in the morning and the city was still pulsing.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 搏动, 跳动, 充满活力

example.eg: The vein in Jerry's forehead pulsed.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 搏动, 振动, 跳动

dsense.name: pulse rate
dsense.guideword: (pace at which the heart is beating)

example.eg: After exercising for 15 minutes my pulse rate was 152 beats per minute.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 脉率, 脉搏率, 脉搏数
